Animal Module

The Animal module provides the base class for all animals in the farm simulation.

Animal Class

class animal.Animal(name)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for all farm animals. This class handles the basic properties and behaviors of animals.

feed()[source]

Feed the animal to reduce hunger and increase health. Returns a message about the feeding result.

get_status()[source]

Get the current status of the animal. Returns a dictionary with all animal properties.

play()[source]

Play with the animal to reduce boredom. Playing increases hunger slightly. Returns a message about the play result.

update()[source]

Update animal’s state each day. Increases hunger and boredom, and checks health. Returns a message if the animal dies.

Description

The Animal class is the base class for all animals in the farm simulation. It provides the core functionality for managing animal states and behaviors.

Properties

  • name: The animal’s name

  • hunger: Current hunger level (0-100)

  • boredom: Current boredom level (0-100)

  • health: Current health level (0-100)

  • age: Animal’s age in days

  • is_alive: Whether the animal is alive

Methods

Animal.feed()[source]

Feed the animal to reduce hunger and increase health. Returns a message about the feeding result.

Animal.play()[source]

Play with the animal to reduce boredom. Playing increases hunger slightly. Returns a message about the play result.

Animal.update()[source]

Update animal’s state each day. Increases hunger and boredom, and checks health. Returns a message if the animal dies.

Animal.get_status()[source]

Get the current status of the animal. Returns a dictionary with all animal properties.

Example Usage

from animal import Animal

# Create a new animal
animal = Animal("Bessie")

# Feed the animal
message = animal.feed()
print(message)  # "Bessie has been fed. Hunger level: 70%"

# Play with the animal
message = animal.play()
print(message)  # "Bessie has played. Boredom level: 40%"

# Update animal state
message = animal.update()
if message:
    print(message)  # Message if animal dies
